ticket.title: Date bug in rails 3
ticket.original-body:
Hi, i just found this bug, it seems that it won't reconize 30. December in Rails 3.0.1. @@@ >> Date.today => Fri, 31 Dec 2010 >> Date.yesterday => Wed, 29 Dec 2010 @@@ I'm using ruby version ruby 1.8.7
Update.
It looks like that it was until 0.59..
ticket.latest-body:
Hi, i just found this bug, it seems that it won't reconize 30. December in Rails 3.0.1. @@@ >> Date.today => Fri, 31 Dec 2010 >> Date.yesterday => Wed, 29 Dec 2010 @@@ I'm using ruby version ruby 1.8.7
Update.
It looks like that it was until 0.59..
ticket.original-body-html:
Hi, i just found this bug, it seems that it won't reconize 30. December in Rails 3.0.1.

>> Date.today
=> Fri, 31 Dec 2010
>> Date.yesterday
=> Wed, 29 Dec 2010
I'm using ruby version ruby 1.8.7

Update.

It looks like that it was until 0.59..

version.body: Same problem in rails 3.0.3, ruby 1.8.7
version.body-html: Same problem in rails 3.0.3, ruby 1.8.7
version.title: Date bug in rails 3

version.body: I am unable to reproduce this with Ruby 1.8.7-p330 and Rails 3.0.1.
version.body-html: I am unable to reproduce this with Ruby 1.8.7-p330 and Rails 3.0.1.
version.title: Date bug in rails 3

version.body: I'm on rails 3.0.3, ruby 1.8.7-p302, the bug only occurred in the first hour of the day, i.e. from 00:00 to 00:59
version.body-html: I'm on rails 3.0.3, ruby 1.8.7-p302, the bug only occurred in the first hour of the day, i.e. from 00:00 to 00:59
version.title: Date bug in rails 3

version.body:
Loading development environment (Rails 3.0.1) ruby-1.8.7-p330 :001 > Date.today => Fri, 31 Dec 2010 ruby-1.8.7-p330 :002 > Date.yesterday => Thu, 30 Dec 2010 ruby-1.8.7-p330 :003 >
That is what I got my system time is set to 12:40AM
version.body-html:
Loading development environment (Rails 3.0.1)
ruby-1.8.7-p330 :001 > Date.today
=> Fri, 31 Dec 2010 ruby-1.8.7-p330 :002 > Date.yesterday
=> Thu, 30 Dec 2010 ruby-1.8.7-p330 :003 >

That is what I got my system time is set to 12:40AM
version.title: Date bug in rails 3

version.body:
I'm using the 24h system, and when i take it to 0.45 on my mac ( 1 hour back ) it gives me this
@@@ >> Date.today => Fri, 31 Dec 2010 >> Date.yesterday => Wed, 29 Dec 2010 @@@
it looks like this in my terminal with the time set back.. https://skitch.com/olufnielsen/r8gqs/systemuiserver
version.body-html:
I'm using the 24h system, and when i take it to 0.45 on my mac ( 1 hour back ) it gives me this

>> Date.today
=> Fri, 31 Dec 2010
>> Date.yesterday
=> Wed, 29 Dec 2010

it looks like this in my terminal with the time set back..
https://skitch.com/olufnielsen/r8gqs/systemuiserver
